017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure;
018
019import com.github.tommyettinger.digital.TrigTools;
020
021import static com.github.tommyettinger.digital.MathTools.barronSpline;
022
023/**
024 * Takes a linear value in the range of 0-1 and outputs a (usually) non-linear, interpolated value.
025 * The <a href="https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Interpolation">wiki docs on Interpolation</a> are extremely useful
026 * for understanding how the different implementations here behave.
027 * <br>
028 * This class is mostly copied directly from libGDX. Changes have been made to avoid copying even more over.
029 * @author Nathan Sweet
030 * @deprecated Use {@link com.github.tommyettinger.digital.Interpolations} from digital instead.
031 */
032@Deprecated
033public final class Interpolations {
034        public static abstract class Interpolation {
035                /**
036                 * @param a Alpha value between 0 and 1.
037                 */
038                abstract public float apply(float a);
039
040                /**
041                 * @param a Alpha value between 0 and 1.
042                 */
043                public float apply(float start, float end, float a) {
044                        return start + (end - start) * apply(a);
045                }
046        }
047
048        //
049
050        static public final Interpolation linear = new Interpolation() {
051                public float apply (float a) {
052                        return a;
053                }
054        };
055
056        //
057
058        /** Aka "smoothstep". */
059        static public final Interpolation smooth = new Interpolation() {
060                public float apply (float a) {
061                        return a * a * (3 - 2 * a);
062                }
063        };
064        static public final Interpolation smooth2 = new Interpolation() {
065                public float apply (float a) {
066                        a = a * a * (3 - 2 * a);
067                        return a * a * (3 - 2 * a);
068                }
069        };
070
071        /** By Ken Perlin. */
072        static public final Interpolation smoother = new Interpolation() {
073                public float apply (float a) {
074                        return a * a * a * (a * (a * 6 - 15) + 10);
075                }
076        };
077        static public final Interpolation fade = smoother;
078
079        //
080
081        static public final Pow pow2 = new Pow(2);
082        /** Slow, then fast. */
083        static public final PowIn pow2In = new PowIn(2);
084        static public final PowIn slowFast = pow2In;
085        /** Fast, then slow. */
086        static public final PowOut pow2Out = new PowOut(2);
087        static public final PowOut fastSlow = pow2Out;
088        static public final Interpolation pow2InInverse = new Interpolation() {
089                public float apply (float a) {
090                        if (a < 0.000001f) return 0;
091                        if (a >= 1f) return 1;
092                        return (float)Math.sqrt(a);
093                }
094        };
095        static public final Interpolation pow2OutInverse = new Interpolation() {
096                public float apply (float a) {
097                        if (a < 0.000001f) return 0;
098                        if (a >= 1f) return 1;
099                        return 1 - (float)Math.sqrt(-(a - 1));
100                }
101        };
102
103        static public final Pow pow3 = new Pow(3);
104        static public final PowIn pow3In = new PowIn(3);
105        static public final PowOut pow3Out = new PowOut(3);
106        static public final Interpolation pow3InInverse = new Interpolation() {
107                public float apply (float a) {
108                        return (float)Math.cbrt(a);
109                }
110        };
111        static public final Interpolation pow3OutInverse = new Interpolation() {
112                public float apply (float a) {
113                        return 1 - (float)Math.cbrt(-(a - 1));
114                }
115        };
116
117        static public final Pow pow4 = new Pow(4);
118        static public final PowIn pow4In = new PowIn(4);
119        static public final PowOut pow4Out = new PowOut(4);
120
121        static public final Pow pow5 = new Pow(5);
122        static public final PowIn pow5In = new PowIn(5);
123        static public final PowOut pow5Out = new PowOut(5);
124
125        static public final Interpolation sine = new Interpolation() {
126                public float apply (float a) {
127                        return (1 - TrigTools.cosTurns(a * 0.5f)) * 0.5f;
128                }
129        };
130
131        static public final Interpolation sineIn = new Interpolation() {
132                public float apply (float a) {
133                        return 1 - TrigTools.cosTurns(a * 0.25f);
134                }
135        };
136
137        static public final Interpolation sineOut = new Interpolation() {
138                public float apply (float a) {
139                        return TrigTools.sinTurns(a * 0.25f);
140                }
141        };
142
143        static public final Exp exp10 = new Exp(2, 10);
144        static public final ExpIn exp10In = new ExpIn(2, 10);
145        static public final ExpOut exp10Out = new ExpOut(2, 10);
146
147        static public final Exp exp5 = new Exp(2, 5);
148        static public final ExpIn exp5In = new ExpIn(2, 5);
149        static public final ExpOut exp5Out = new ExpOut(2, 5);
150
151        static public final Interpolation circle = new Interpolation() {
152                public float apply (float a) {
153                        if (a <= 0.5f) {
154                                a *= 2;
155                                return (1 - (float)Math.sqrt(1 - a * a)) / 2;
156                        }
157                        a--;
158                        a *= 2;
159                        return ((float)Math.sqrt(1 - a * a) + 1) / 2;
160                }
161        };
162
163        static public final Interpolation circleIn = new Interpolation() {
164                public float apply (float a) {
165                        return 1 - (float)Math.sqrt(1 - a * a);
166                }
167        };
168
169        static public final Interpolation circleOut = new Interpolation() {
170                public float apply (float a) {
171                        a--;
172                        return (float)Math.sqrt(1 - a * a);
173                }
174        };
175
176        static public final Elastic elastic = new Elastic(2, 10, 7, 1);
177        static public final ElasticIn elasticIn = new ElasticIn(2, 10, 6, 1);
178        static public final ElasticOut elasticOut = new ElasticOut(2, 10, 7, 1);
179
180        static public final Swing swing = new Swing(1.5f);
181        static public final SwingIn swingIn = new SwingIn(2f);
182        static public final SwingOut swingOut = new SwingOut(2f);
183
184        static public final Bounce bounce = new Bounce(4);
185        static public final BounceIn bounceIn = new BounceIn(4);
186        static public final BounceOut bounceOut = new BounceOut(4);
187
188        //
189
190        static public class Pow extends Interpolation {
191                final int power;
192
193                public Pow (int power) {
194                        this.power = power;
195                }
196
197                public float apply (float a) {
198                        if (a <= 0.5f) return (float)Math.pow(a * 2, power) / 2;
199                        return (float)Math.pow((a - 1) * 2, power) / (power % 2 == 0 ? -2 : 2) + 1;
200                }
201        }
202
203        static public class PowIn extends Pow {
204                public PowIn (int power) {
205                        super(power);
206                }
207
208                public float apply (float a) {
209                        return (float)Math.pow(a, power);
210                }
211        }
212
213        static public class PowOut extends Pow {
214                public PowOut (int power) {
215                        super(power);
216                }
217
218                public float apply (float a) {
219                        return (float)Math.pow(a - 1, power) * (power % 2 == 0 ? -1 : 1) + 1;
220                }
221        }
222
223        //
224
225        static public class Exp extends Interpolation {
226                final float value, power, min, scale;
227
228                public Exp (float value, float power) {
229                        this.value = value;
230                        this.power = power;
231                        min = (float)Math.pow(value, -power);
232                        scale = 1 / (1 - min);
233                }
234
235                public float apply (float a) {
236                        if (a <= 0.5f) return ((float)Math.pow(value, power * (a * 2 - 1)) - min) * scale / 2;
237                        return (2 - ((float)Math.pow(value, -power * (a * 2 - 1)) - min) * scale) / 2;
238                }
239        }
240
241        static public class ExpIn extends Exp {
242                public ExpIn (float value, float power) {
243                        super(value, power);
244                }
245
246                public float apply (float a) {
247                        return ((float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) - min) * scale;
248                }
249        }
250
251        static public class ExpOut extends Exp {
252                public ExpOut (float value, float power) {
253                        super(value, power);
254                }
255
256                public float apply (float a) {
257                        return 1 - ((float)Math.pow(value, -power * a) - min) * scale;
258                }
259        }
260
261        //
262
263        static public class Elastic extends Interpolation {
264                final float value, power, scale, bounces;
265
266                public Elastic (float value, float power, int bounces, float scale) {
267                        this.value = value;
268                        this.power = power;
269                        this.scale = scale;
270                        this.bounces = bounces * (0.5f - (bounces & 1));
271                }
272
273                public float apply (float a) {
274                        if (a <= 0.5f) {
275                                a *= 2;
276                                return (float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) * TrigTools.sinTurns(a * bounces) * scale / 2;
277                        }
278                        a = 1 - a;
279                        a *= 2;
280                        return 1 - (float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) * TrigTools.sinTurns((a) * bounces) * scale / 2;
281                }
282        }
283
284        static public class ElasticIn extends Elastic {
285                public ElasticIn (float value, float power, int bounces, float scale) {
286                        super(value, power, bounces, scale);
287                }
288
289                public float apply (float a) {
290                        if (a >= 0.99) return 1;
291                        return (float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) * TrigTools.sinTurns(a * bounces) * scale;
292                }
293        }
294
295        static public class ElasticOut extends Elastic {
296                public ElasticOut (float value, float power, int bounces, float scale) {
297                        super(value, power, bounces, scale);
298                }
299
300                public float apply (float a) {
301                        if (a == 0) return 0;
302                        a = 1 - a;
303                        return (1 - (float)Math.pow(value, power * (a - 1)) * TrigTools.sinTurns(a * bounces) * scale);
304                }
305        }
306
307        //
308
309        static public class Bounce extends BounceOut {
310                public Bounce (float[] widths, float[] heights) {
311                        super(widths, heights);
312                }
313
314                public Bounce (int bounces) {
315                        super(bounces);
316                }
317
318                private float out (float a) {
319                        float test = a + widths[0] / 2;
320                        if (test < widths[0]) return test / (widths[0] / 2) - 1;
321                        return super.apply(a);
322                }
323
324                public float apply (float a) {
325                        if (a <= 0.5f) return (1 - out(1 - a * 2)) / 2;
326                        return out(a * 2 - 1) / 2 + 0.5f;
327                }
328        }
329
330        static public class BounceOut extends Interpolation {
331                final float[] widths, heights;
332
333                public BounceOut (float[] widths, float[] heights) {
334                        if (widths.length != heights.length)
335                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Must be the same number of widths and heights.");
336                        this.widths = widths;
337                        this.heights = heights;
338                }
339
340                public BounceOut (int bounces) {
341                        if (bounces < 2 || bounces > 5) throw new IllegalArgumentException("bounces cannot be < 2 or > 5: " + bounces);
342                        widths = new float[bounces];
343                        heights = new float[bounces];
344                        heights[0] = 1;
345                        switch (bounces) {
346                        case 2:
347                                widths[0] = 0.6f;
348                                widths[1] = 0.4f;
349                                heights[1] = 0.33f;
350                                break;
351                        case 3:
352                                widths[0] = 0.4f;
353                                widths[1] = 0.4f;
354                                widths[2] = 0.2f;
355                                heights[1] = 0.33f;
356                                heights[2] = 0.1f;
357                                break;
358                        case 4:
359                                widths[0] = 0.34f;
360                                widths[1] = 0.34f;
361                                widths[2] = 0.2f;
362                                widths[3] = 0.15f;
363                                heights[1] = 0.26f;
364                                heights[2] = 0.11f;
365                                heights[3] = 0.03f;
366                                break;
367                        case 5:
368                                widths[0] = 0.3f;
369                                widths[1] = 0.3f;
370                                widths[2] = 0.2f;
371                                widths[3] = 0.1f;
372                                widths[4] = 0.1f;
373                                heights[1] = 0.45f;
374                                heights[2] = 0.3f;
375                                heights[3] = 0.15f;
376                                heights[4] = 0.06f;
377                                break;
378                        }
379                        widths[0] *= 2;
380                }
381
382                public float apply (float a) {
383                        if (a == 1) return 1;
384                        a += widths[0] / 2;
385                        float width = 0, height = 0;
386                        for (int i = 0, n = widths.length; i < n; i++) {
387                                width = widths[i];
388                                if (a <= width) {
389                                        height = heights[i];
390                                        break;
391                                }
392                                a -= width;
393                        }
394                        a /= width;
395                        float z = 4 / width * height * a;
396                        return 1 - (z - z * a) * width;
397                }
398        }
399
400        static public class BounceIn extends BounceOut {
401                public BounceIn (float[] widths, float[] heights) {
402                        super(widths, heights);
403                }
404
405                public BounceIn (int bounces) {
406                        super(bounces);
407                }
408
409                public float apply (float a) {
410                        return 1 - super.apply(1 - a);
411                }
412        }
413
414        //
415
416        static public class Swing extends Interpolation {
417                private final float scale;
418
419                public Swing (float scale) {
420                        this.scale = scale * 2;
421                }
422
423                public float apply (float a) {
424                        if (a <= 0.5f) {
425                                a *= 2;
426                                return a * a * ((scale + 1) * a - scale) / 2;
427                        }
428                        a--;
429                        a *= 2;
430                        return a * a * ((scale + 1) * a + scale) / 2 + 1;
431                }
432        }
433
434        static public class SwingOut extends Interpolation {
435                private final float scale;
436
437                public SwingOut (float scale) {
438                        this.scale = scale;
439                }
440
441                public float apply (float a) {
442                        a--;
443                        return a * a * ((scale + 1) * a + scale) + 1;
444                }
445        }
446
447        static public class SwingIn extends Interpolation {
448                private final float scale;
449
450                public SwingIn (float scale) {
451                        this.scale = scale;
452                }
453
454                public float apply (float a) {
455                        return a * a * ((scale + 1) * a - scale);
456                }
457        }
458
459
460        /**
461         * A wrapper around {@link com.github.tommyettinger.digital.MathTools#barronSpline(float, float, float)} to use it
462         * as an Interpolation. Useful because it can imitate the wide variety of symmetrical Interpolations by setting
463         * turning to 0.5 and shape to some value greater than 1, while also being able to produce the inverse of those
464         * interpolations by setting shape to some value between 0 and 1.
465         */
466        public static class BiasGain extends Interpolation {
467                /**
468                 * The shape parameter will cause this to imitate "smoothstep-like" splines when greater than 1 (where the
469                 * values ease into their starting and ending levels), or to be the inverse when less than 1 (where values
470                 * start like square root does, taking off very quickly, but also end like square does, landing abruptly at
471                 * the ending level).
472                 */
473                public final float shape;
474                /**
475                 * A value between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive, where the shape changes.
476                 */
477                public final float turning;
478
479                public BiasGain (float shape, float turning) {
480                        this.shape = shape;
481                        this.turning = turning;
482                }
483
484                public float apply (float a) {
485                        return barronSpline(a, shape, turning);
486                }
487        }
488
489}
